metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14774 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in HttpKernel in Symfony 2.7.0 through 2.7.48,2.8.0 through 2.8.43, 3.3.0 through 3.3.17, 3.4.0 through 3.4.13, 4.0.0through 4.0.13, and 4.1.0 through 4.1.2. When using HttpCache, the valuesof the X-Forwarded-Host headers are implicitly set as trusted while thisshould be forbidden, leading to potential host header injection.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14774` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

php-symfony - 3.4.15+dfsg-2ubuntu4
php-symfony-amazon-mailer - 3.4.15+dfsg-2ubuntu4
php-symfony-amazon-sqs-messenger - 3.4.15+dfsg-2ubuntu4

criterions.comment: symfony package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.15+dfsg-2ubuntu4').
